body_html:
You can also flatten the state using nest.flatten and get the batch size
from the first entry.

On Nov 11, 2016 10:30 PM, "Thang Luong" notifications@github.com wrote:

@alrojo https://github.com/alrojo: one more thing, the way we obtain the
batch_size from encoder_state in simple_decoder_fn_inference is not correct
when encoder_state is a tuple, e.g., when using BasicLSTMCell. Perhaps, we
can pass batch_size as another argument to that simple_decoder_fn_inference?

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.

You can also flatten the state using nest.flatten and get the batch size
from the first entry.

On Nov 11, 2016 10:30 PM, "Thang Luong" notifications@github.com wrote:

@alrojo https://github.com/alrojo: one more thing, the way we obtain the

when encoder_state is a tuple, e.g., when using BasicLSTMCell. Perhaps, we
